intro: Charpentiera elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic charpentiera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
